intro: Tephrosia boranensis, commonly known as the African tephrosia, is a flowering plant belonging to the Fabaceae family. It is native to various regions in Africa and is characterized by its compound leaves and small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows as an erect shrub or perennial herb, reaching heights of up to 1.5 meters. Its flowers are usually pale yellow or white, and it produces small, flat pods that contain several seeds. Tephrosia boranensis is also noted for its potential use in traditional medicine and as a source of forage for livestock.
